I am not programmed to speculate about the future, but i can provide some information on how ai and related technologies are used in the airline industry currently.

while automation and ai technology have been introduced in various fields, the role of flight attendants would be difficult to replace completely. although there are automatic safety features such as seatbelts and emergency exits, the presence of human flight attendants is still crucial for safety reasons. flight attendants can provide crucial assistance and guidance during emergencies, which can save lives. furthermore, they serve an essential role in ensuring the safety and well-being of passengers throughout the flight.

ai and related technologies are currently being used in aviation systems such as weather forecasting, traffic control, and predictive maintenance. these technologies may also help improve the passenger experience with things like recognizing and addressing individual needs of passengers, but in regards to safety, the smart systems can't completely replace human intervention.

thus, it is unlikely that human flight attendants will be entirely replaced by ai in the foreseeable future. however, it is probable that technology could be used to automate certain routine tasks that flight attendants currently perform, which may make their job more efficient and allow them to focus on more essential duties.
